title: Integration Studio—SPM/PPM integration
content:
You can integrate Service Management with Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM, also known as ValueEdge Strategy) or Project and Portfolio Management (PPM). This integration enables you to create Proposals in PPM or Epics in SPM for Service Management Ideas. It also enables you to create projects in PPM for Service Management Proposals. The lifecycle of these records can then be managed in PPM or SPM.

Use case 1 - Idea to Epic in SPM or Idea to Proposal in PPM

In case an idea is classified as a valid item to create an Epic or Proposal, the idea reviewer can decide to open an Epic in SPM or a Proposal in PPM. The integration copies the information into the target system and updates the Idea record.

Use case 2 – Proposal to Project in PPM 

In case a Proposal in Service Management is classified as a valid item to create a Project in PPM, the proposal reviewer can decide to open a Project in PPM. The integration copies the information into the target system and updates the Proposal record. 

The integration use cases described in this document serve as examples to inspire and guide your integration efforts. However, they should not be considered as prescriptive or guaranteed solutions for your particular scenario. The examples may or may not be applicable for your license edition.


Set up the integration

As an example, the procedure below will set up the integration to implement the documented use cases. 

The business logic for forwarding tickets from SMAX to PPM or SPM is implemented by the following predefined scenario templates:

  • Idea to Epic in SPM, to track Ideas as Epics in SPM
  • Idea to Proposal in PPM, to track Ideas as Request for proposal in PPM
  • Proposals to Projects in PPM, to track Proposals as Projects in PPM

You can create integration scenarios based on these scenario templates, and then update some environment-specific or control parameters to fine-tune the system behavior.

Prepare integration user 

Perform the following steps to prepare an integration user:

  1. Create an integration user. See How to create an integration user. 

  2. Log in to the Agent Interface as the tenant admin, and do the following: 

    • Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People, locate the integration user, and assign the proper roles to access the required modules. 

      At a minimum, the role should have the following permission or add the Tenant Admin role to grant general access.

    • (If not Tenant Admin) Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People > Roles, create a new role with Create, View, and Update permissions for the External reference and External system record types, and then assign the role to the integration user.

       

Export the certificate from the PPM or SPM instance

To connect to PPM or SPM, you'll need to upload their root CA certificate in a later step. You can export the certificate from the browser as base64 encoded to a file.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

Log in to the Agent Interface as the tenant admin.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  2. Click Add.
  3. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, PPM or SPM), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  4. Click Configure and complete the fields depending on whether the endpoint uses the OPB Agent.
    If the endpoint doesn't use the OPB Agent, complete these fields:
    FieldValue
    Agent 
    Select Agentless for a direct connection to PPM or SPM.
    Authentication type 
    Select  Basic Authentication.
    Protocol 
    Select  https. 
    Base URL 
    Enter the base URL of the PPM or SPM instance: https://<FQDN>.
    Username 
    Enter the username of the integration user of the PPM or SPM system. 
    Password 
    Enter the Password of the integration user of the PPM or SPM system. 
    Confirm password 
    Re-enter the password.
    Certificate type 
    Select  X.509. 
    Certificate format 
    Select  PEM. 
    Server certificate 
    Open the root CA certificate file of SPM/PPM system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step.  
    The certificate content must resemble the following. 

    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
    MIIF2TCCBMGgAwIBAgIQBMF1U8hY8bivE0+JHx922jANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQsFADBG
    MQswCQYDVQQGEwJVUzEPMA0GA1UEChMGQW1hem9uMRUwEwYDVQQLEwxTZXJ2ZXIg
    Q0EgMUIxDzANBgNVBAMTBkFtYXpvbjAeFw0yMTEwMTEwMDAwMDBaFw0yMjExMDky
    MzU5NTlaMBsxGTAXBgNVBAMTEHhpZS5pdHNtYS1uZy5vcmcwggEiMA0GCSqGSIb3
    1oIvQfpl2gj0S6JSJAYjJnY7HKCa7mkzBMiiXWI5aHMZfl1FsaNARM10LUpto61f
    Ivk/SDNlOqVXuzGMTZkJBVZVmK5lNLvBB1Gk9+QlJ+SuUOW7FW2K5U+oQKWsHtvH
    …
    -----END CERTIFICATE-----

    If the endpoint uses the OPB Agent, complete these fields. For more information, see How to use On-Premises Bridge agents on Windows or How to use On-Premises Bridge agents on Linux.
    Field  
    Value  
    Agent  
    		Select the OPB agent that you have created. 
    Authentication type  Select Basic Authentication.
    Protocol  Select https. 
    Base URL  
    		Enter the base URL of the PPM or SPM system: https://FQDN
    CredentialsSelect the credentials record that you've created for the endpoint in the Endpoint Credentials Manager.

Create an integration

Perform the following steps to create an integration based on the SPM connector. 

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.  
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Strategic Portfolio Management (under OpenText) as the connector, select the PPM/SPM endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.  

Configure the scenarios 

Perform the following steps to add and configure scenarios by using the predefined templates:

  1. Click Add scenario.  
  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, enter Idea to Proposal. 
  3. In the Template field, select Idea to Proposal in PPM (under OpenText Strategic Portfolio Management) from the list. 
  4. Click Save to add the scenario. 
  5. Repeat the steps above to add scenarios based on the other templates (Ideal to Epic in SPM, Proposal to Project in PPM).
    Note Using templates will make the integration configuration easier than starting from scratch. If you don't select this option, you'll have to manually add your own logic, starting from a blank page.

Parameters to be configured for the Idea to Proposal in PPM scenario

In the Parameters rule at the start of the Process logic section, enter the details:

  • RequestType – Keep the default PFM – Proposal.
  • DefaultBusinessUnit – Enter your default business unit, which is used when SendSMAXBusinessUnit is false. 
  • SendSMAXBusinessUnit – If set to true, send the Business Unit set in the Service Management Idea to PPM. In this case, ensure the Business Units are in sync between SMAX and PPM.
  • EndpointName – Enter the SMAX endpoint name you configured earlier.

Parameters to be configured for the Proposal to Project in PPM scenario

In the Parameters rule at the start of the Process logic section, enter the details: 

  • ProjecType – Enter a valid project type from PPM.
  • DefaultBusinessUnit – Enter your default business unit, which is used when SendSMAXBusinessUnit is false. 
  • SendSMAXBusinessUnit – If set to true, send the Business Unit set in the Service Management Proposal to PPM. In this case, ensure the Business Units are in sync between SMAX and PPM. 
  • Region – The region of your project. Enter a valid value from PPM. 
  • EndpointName – Enter the SMAX endpoint name you configured earlier.

Parameters to be configured for the Idea to Epic in SPM scenario

In the Parameters rule at the start of the process logic, enter the details: 

  • RequestType – Keep the default Portfolio Epic.
  • DefaultBusinessUnit – Enter your default business unit, which is used when SendSMAXBusinessUnit is false. 
  • SendSMAXBusinessUnit – If set to true, send the Business Unit set in the Service Management Idea to SPM. In this case, ensure the Business Units are in sync between SMAX and SPM. 
  • Region – The region of your project. Enter a valid value from SPM. 
  • EndpointName – Enter the SMAX endpoint name you configured earlier.
  • EpicType - Keep the default Business.

Use the scenarios 

Idea to Proposal in PPM / Idea to Epic in SPM 

As the integration and endpoint are already created, all you need to do is to create a business rule that triggers the integration based on your condition.

The following example shows how to configure a custom action to trigger the integration. Navigate to Studio > Idea > Custom Actions and create a new custom action. 

Example: 

Now add a trigger for the integration when the custom action is clicked. Navigate to Studio > Idea > Processes and Rules > After applying changes and add a new “Call Integration Studio” business rule.
 

The condition in this example is ${current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged && entity.CustomActionName_c=='CreateRequest'}. This means when the custom action “Create Epic in SPM” is clicked, the integration is triggered. 

Proposal to Project in PPM 

As the integration and endpoint are already created, all you need to do is to create a business rule that triggers the integration based on your condition. 

The following example shows how to configure a custom action to trigger the integration. Navigate to Studio > Proposal > Custom Actions and create a new custom action.  

Example:
 

Now add a trigger for the integration when the custom action is clicked. Navigate to Studio > Proposal > Processes and Rules > After applying changes and add a new “Call Integration Studio” business rule.

The condition in this example is ${current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged && entity.CustomActionName_c=='CreateProject'}. This means when the custom action “Create Project in PPM” is clicked, the integration is triggered. 

Understand the integration

The following describes the logic of the scenario rules so that you can customize the scenario as needed.

Each scenario is following the same principles.  

  1. Defines some default parameters.
  2. Gets data from Service Management.
  3. Prepares data as required by PPM/SPM.
  4. Creates the record in PPM/SPM.
  5. Adds a comment to the record in PPM/SPM.
  6. Updates the record in Service Management.

The main logic is added in steps 3 and 4.

In step 3, the data is manipulated and prepared for SPM/PPM. For example, the description is converted to plain text.

In step 4, the payload for PPM/SPM is created by using the data prepared in step 3.

If the record is successfully created in the target system, a comment is added.
